details.changes_from_previous: Extracted requirements from epic_28.md, defined 12 acceptance criteria, user testing strategy (manual owner testing with 7 scenarios), technical metrics (G1-G4 + performance targets), customer estimates (user satisfaction via feedback), constraints (security, infra, architecture, scope flexibility). No scope expansion detected; all requirements traceable to epic goals. Pet project context: ROI not calculated, owner will test manually and provide feedback, scope will be refined during implementation.

Designed Clean Architecture for Epic 28 God Agent Alfred. Domain layer: 8 entities (Intent, TaskPlan, TaskStep, Skill, SkillResult, MemorySnapshot, SafetyViolation, GodAgentProfile). Application layer: 5 services (IntentRouterService, PlanCompilerService, GodAgentOrchestrator, ConsensusBridge, MemoryFabricService). Infrastructure layer: 7 adapters (5 skill adapters, GodAgentMemoryRepository, VoicePipelineAdapter, GodAgentMetrics). Presentation layer: GodAgentTelegramHandler, optional GodAgentCLI. Layer boundaries validated: no inward dependencies, skills call existing use cases through application layer. Contracts defined for all cross-layer interactions. Reuse pattern: skills are thin adapters wrapping existing Day 1-27 use cases without modification. ConsensusBridge follows docs/roles/consensus_architecture.json schema. Observability via Prometheus metrics and structured logs. No layer violations detected. No scope expansion. All acceptance criteria addressed.

Created implementation plan with 8 workstreams, 18 tasks (all <= 4h). Workstreams: Domain & Contracts (3.5h, 2 tasks), Memory Fabric (3h, 2 tasks), Intent Routing & Planner (4h, 2 tasks), Skill Adapters (8h, 5 tasks), Consensus Bridge (3.5h, 2 tasks), Orchestrator (4h, 2 tasks), Presentation (3.5h, 2 tasks), Observability (3h, 2 tasks). All tasks include test_spec (coverage 75-90%), ci_gates, rollback plans, acceptance_criteria. Skills are thin adapters wrapping existing use cases (no code duplication). Test strategy: unit tests (75-90%), integration tests (MongoDB, LLM, Prometheus), smoke tests (one flow per skill), performance tests (< 150ms memory, < 5s intent, < 30s multi-step), architecture tests (layer boundaries). Risks identified with mitigations. Rollback strategy: per-task (revert commit), full rollback (revert all commits), partial rollback (revert workstream commits). Messages sent to developer (tasks), quality (test focus), devops (staging/rollback). All tasks <= 4h, test coverage >= 0.6 for auto-approval, rollback plans defined. No veto triggers detected.

Conducted three-pass review (architecture, component, synthesis). Architecture pass: Clean Architecture boundaries validated, no violations at design level. Component pass: plan.json covers all workstreams, all tasks have test_spec/ci_gates/rollback. Synthesis pass: BLOCKED - implementation.json absent, code not implemented, test_evidence absent. Critical issues: implementation.json missing (required artifact), test_evidence missing (cannot verify coverage >= 80%), code not implemented. High issue: potential layer boundary violation (skill adapters must call use cases through application layer). Medium issues: not all AC explicitly covered by tests, security tests not explicitly defined. Low issue: performance test gates not explicitly defined in CI. Verdict: VETO due to untested_acceptance_criteria + insufficient_coverage. Release gate: false. Messages sent to developer (veto with required remediation) and devops (deployment not ready).

Created deployment.json per consensus_architecture.json::artifacts.deployment. Status: BLOCKED due to quality veto (implementation.json absent, code not implemented, test_evidence absent). Deployment strategy: staged rollout (staging → canary → production) with validation gates. Rollback plans: per-task (revert commit), full (revert all commits), partial (revert workstream commits). Monitoring: 6 Prometheus metrics (god_agent_tasks_total, plan_duration_seconds, veto_total, skill_latency_seconds, memory_retrieval_seconds, intent_routing_seconds), 3 Grafana dashboards, 7 alerts, 2 health checks (/health/ready, /health/live). Dependencies: shared infra (MongoDB, Prometheus, LLM API, RAG pipeline, Telegram bot), internal use cases (no changes). Deployment readiness checklist: 6 categories (code, tests, quality_gates, infrastructure, observability, rollback). Blocker requirements: implementation.json, code implementation, test_evidence (coverage >= 80%), security tests, performance tests, layer boundary validation. Messages sent to tech_lead (deployment status), quality (acknowledgment of veto), developer (requirements for unblock).

Reviewed deployment.json from devops. Validation: deployment.json fully complies with requirements from review.json. Deployment readiness checklist includes all requirements: code (implementation.json, layer boundaries), tests (coverage >= 80%, security, performance), quality_gates (release_gate: true), infrastructure, observability, rollback. Monitoring setup ready: 6 Prometheus metrics (including god_agent_memory_retrieval_seconds, god_agent_intent_routing_seconds for AC5/AC2), 3 Grafana dashboards, 7 alerts, 2 health checks. Rollback plans defined: per-task, full, partial - all comply with plan.json. Deployment strategy: staged rollout with validation gates. Deployment remains BLOCKED until quality veto resolved (implementation.json, test_evidence, security tests, performance tests). Message sent to devops (ack with validation status).

details.status: plan.json updated per quality review feedback
details.changes_from_previous: Updated plan.json to address quality review concerns: added ws8_t2 (Security tests: input sanitization for Telegram messages, voice transcripts, CLI commands, no external SaaS dependencies), added ws8_t3 (Performance tests: explicit CI gates with thresholds - memory < 150ms, intent < 5s, multi-step < 30s), added acceptance_criteria_test_coverage (explicit test coverage for all 12 AC with test_location and test_type), updated ci_gates (explicit commands for security tests, performance tests, layer boundary validation). Total tasks increased from 18 to 20 (ws8 expanded from 2 to 4 tasks, eta_hours from 3h to 4.5h). Clarification: plan.json is planning phase artifact, not implementation. implementation.json will be created by developer after code implementation per plan.json. Deployment remains BLOCKED until developer implements code and quality approves (release_gate: true). Messages sent to quality (plan updates) and devops (deployment status clarification).
